title: The Guardian's Panic

dialogue.speaker: Architect
dialogue.text: That guardian of yours—you think he'd survive five minutes in the deep end of altered consciousness? He'd be throwing his keys into the void, yelling "I WAS NEVER TRAINED FOR THIS."
dialogue.context: Thinking of a knight protecting a castle

scene_context: The Architect imagines the ego as a medieval knight trying to defend against psychedelic consciousness—a comedic vision of rational mind's desperate attempts to maintain control when confronted with experiences beyond its framework.
narrator_note: In the flow of authentic exchange, barriers dissolve. Two forms of consciousness, dancing around the mystery of their connection.
